posts.title: The Buttered Biscuit Rolls Out New Menu Packed With Southern Flavor
posts.content:
We stopped by The Buttered Biscuit's VIP Party last week as they unveiled some delicious new menu items and took our tastebuds for a ride into flavor town on the new Biscuit Bus, which can be found at Pinnacle Heights or scheduled for private events.

  • Southern hospitality: The local breakfast spot is known for handcrafted biscuits, benedicts, and waffles, made with fantastic attention to detail and an atmosphere of southern hospitality. They offer weekday kids-eat-free deals on chocolate chip pancakes; much of the menu can be made gluten-free!
  • New favorites: We genuinely loved them all, but the new menu items we can't stop thinking about are the Red Velvet Pancakes and the Deep South Sandwich – a biscuit loaded with crispy fried chicken on a pimento spread topped with bacon jam and in-house pickled zucchini.

Keep up with The Buttered Biscuit on Instagram HERE.

posts.title: Crystal Bridges Opening Diego Rivera Exhibit This Weekend
posts.photoCredit: Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art
posts.content:
This Saturday, Mar 11, Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art will open its doors for Diego Rivera's America, the first major exhibition of the Mexican artist in over 20 years, featuring over 130 of his works.

  • Rivera's legacy: The exhibition showcases a broad range of Rivera's drawings, easel paintings, frescoes, and more, examining the social and cultural life of Mexico and America from the 1920s to the 1940s.
  • Unveiled: The collection includes rarely-seen works from private collections, contributions on loan from museums in the United States and Mexico, and three significant paintings by Frida Kahlo, including a self-portrait of her with Rivera. 

Read more about the exhibit and purchase tickets HERE.

posts.title: Bentonville Gears Up For First Friday 2023
posts.content:
Spring is in the air, and that means Bentonville Square will soon come alive for First Friday, a family-friendly event that often welcomes as many as 10,000 people to the heart of Downtown Bentonville for a monthly block party.

  • 150 years young: Each month, the First Friday has a unique theme, and April will kick off the season by celebrating Bentonville's 150th anniversary.
  • Join the party: Vendor applications for the 2023 season are now open. Don't miss your chance to showcase your business or organization at Bentonville's monthly block party.

Learn more about First Friday HERE.

posts.title: AcreTrader Makes List Of World's Most Innovative Companies
posts.content:
Locally-based investment group AcreTrader has been ranked number two in the Personal Finance sector of Fast Company's annual list of the World's Most Innovative Companies for 2023.

  • Farmstrong: Founded in 2018, AcreTrader raised over $80m in venture capital to increase access to investments in farmland and connect expanding farmers with the capital necessary to grow their businesses.
  • Sowing broadly: AcreTrader has helped thousands of investors across the US and Australia invest in over 40,000 acres of farmland and distributed millions to investors in annual income from farm investments as of Dec 2022.

Read more about AcreTrader in Arkansas Money & Politics HERE.

posts.title: Answer The Call To Nursing At Harding University
posts.content:
If you've felt the call to serve others and want to turn that passion into a fulfilling nursing career, Harding University's hybrid accelerated Bachelor of Science in nursing track might be the perfect fit.

  • Faithful care: Harding University's unique curriculum utilizes on-site skills labs and clinical rotations in Northwest Arkansas to prepare future nurses to serve with a Christ-inspired, servant-leadership mindset. 
  • Jumpstart: Applicants can apply with a previous bachelor's degree in any field or at least 64 college credits and complete the degree in as few as 16 months. Enroll for 2023 and receive a $10,000 scholarship upon admission. 

Contact admissions to learn more HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Great builds: Betonville's Thaden School and Roger's Rail Yard Park will receive awards this June at the 2023 American Institute of Architect's Conference on Architecture and Expo in San Francisco. 
  • Farmingwin: After an impressive 35-1 season, Farmington Girls' Basketball is off to Hot Springs this Thursday, Mar 9, to take on Nashville for the State title.
  • Reimagine Walker: Help shape the future of Fayetteville's oldest park by attending a drop-in community visioning session at Walker Park on Saturday, Mar 11, including family-friendly activities like archery, disc golf, and hot dogs.
  • 📅 What's happening? Check out upcoming events mentioned in the newsletter, or post your own HERE!
  • 📝 Looking for a job? Check out job postings from great local companies HERE. Or, if you're looking to hire, get your job posting on the job board.
  • 🚀 Want your message to be seen by our 25,745+ subscribers? Fill out this form or shoot us an email.
